definition: A shortened form of a word or phrase.
sentence: LOL is an abbreviation for “laugh out loud”.

definition: A state of temporary inactivity.
sentence: The completion of the new playground was held in abeyance until further funding could be secured.

definition: An act of washing oneself.
sentence: He performed his morning ablutions before starting his day.

definition: To wear off by scraping or rubbing.
sentence: The constant breaking of the waves will abrade the cliff wall.

definition: A structural component typically found at both ends of a bridge.
sentence: An early bridge was made of timber with a stone abutment at each end.

definition: A deep or seemingly bottomless chasm.
sentence: The abyss of the Mariana Trench is the deepest part of any ocean on the planet.

definition: Awards or honours; recognition.
sentence: The team received many accolades after winning the championship.

definition: A charge of wrong-doing.
sentence: After the accusation of cheating, there had to be an investigation.

definition: The purchase or addition of something.
sentence: The museum curator was excited about the new acquisition.

definition: A synthetic textile fibre.
sentence: Most fibres made of acrylic are non-flammable.

definition: To make a formal judgement in a competition.
sentence: The retired teacher was pleased to be asked to help adjudicate the speech arts competition.

definition: Maritime law.
sentence: Maritime or admiralty law governs nautical issues and private maritime disputes.

definition: Public support for, or recommendation of, a particular cause or policy.
sentence: After decades of advocacy and activism, the law was passed.

definition: A desert plant.
sentence: The agave has narrow spiny leaves and tall flower spikes.

definition: The sum of many separate units.
sentence: At the end of the day, the aggregate of the company’s debt led them to declare bankruptcy.

definition: Cheerful readiness or willingness.
sentence: We accepted the invitation with alacrity.

definition: To reduce or relieve a problem.
sentence: Yoga can help to alleviate stress.

definition: In reference to biology, occurring in non-overlapping geographical areas.
sentence: Even though the plants were of the same species, they had allopatric distribution.

definition: A mixture or blend.
sentence: The wedding was an amalgam of traditional and modern practices.

definition: A disorder characterized by a deficiency of red blood cells.
sentence: Pallor and weariness are symptoms of anaemia.

definition: A calcium-iron garnet occurring in various colours.
sentence: The ring was set with brilliant green andradite stones.

definition: Additional material at the end of a book or magazine, usually of an explanatory nature.
sentence: In the appendix, the author included some further information that the reader might find interesting.

definition: The act of estimating or judging the value of something.
sentence: The homeowner had an appraisal done for insurance purposes.

definition: Referring to a building having columns at one or both ends, but not along the sides.
sentence: The guide pointed out the apteral design of the classical Greek temple.

definition: Referring to a nose that is hooked, similar to an eagle’s beak.
sentence: The artist beautifully captured the subject’s aquiline nose.

definition: Land suitable for growing crops.
sentence: The farmer had 90 acres of arable land and 10 acres of woodlot.

definition: A person who studies history by examining objects dug up from the ground.
sentence: It is amazing to see the painstaking techniques used by the archeologist at the dig.

definition: Large calibre guns.
sentence: During the war games, the military fired the heavy artillery.

definition: A sudden, violent attack.
sentence: The policeman suffered an assault when trying to make an arrest.

definition: Shelter or protection from danger.
sentence: The political activist sought asylum in the embassy when his life was threatened.

definition: The mixture of gases that surrounds Earth or other celestial body.
sentence: The atmosphere protects us from the sun’s harmful radiation and provides us with air to breathe.

definition: Usual or ordinary.
sentence: The suspect was described as being of average height.

definition: An even distribution of weight enabling someone to remain upright and steady.
sentence: The tight-rope walker had perfect balance on the wire.

definition: A weapon used from ancient times to the Middle Ages to hurl large objects at an enemy.
sentence: The ballista is more like a giant crossbow than a catapult.

definition: A bench that has an upholstered seat and is placed along a wall.
sentence: At the restaurant they chose a corner table with a banquette.

definition: The beating or driving of game from cover toward a stationary hunter.
sentence: During the battue, rabbits were forced out of the bushes where they had been hiding, and towards the open field.

definition: A person who gives money to help another person or a cause.
sentence: The hospital’s benefactor helped to purchase new equipment.

definition: Relating to living organisms of a particular region.
sentence: The new trail and information centre was designed to show the biological diversity of the area.

definition: A thick stick used as a weapon.
sentence: The story, set in medieval times, held him spellbound reading about the guard standing ready with his bludgeon.

definition: Abundant or plentiful.
sentence: Some people worry that Canada’s bountiful supply of water could be in danger.

definition: One who is boastful or conceited.
sentence: The hockey star was a braggart about her skills.

definition: A type of German pork sausage.
sentence: At the fair, they enjoyed bratwurst on a bun.

definition: A state of winter dormancy entered into by some cold-blooded animals as part of their normal annual rhythm.
sentence: During brumation, reptiles still have periods of activity, where they drink but do not eat.

definition: Insensitive or unsympathetic.
sentence: The callous words hurt her feelings very badly.

definition: A unit of energy, equal to the kilocalorie
sentence: The man counted every calorie while he was trying to lose weight.

definition: A small character part in a play or movie, portrayed by a famous actor.
sentence: Alfred Hitchcock was notable for doing a cameo in each of his movies.

definition: A small piece of bread or toast with a savoury topping.
sentence: Her favourite canape was smoked salmon.

definition: A long projecting beam fixed only at one end.
sentence: The skywalk over the Grand Canyon is a cantilever.

definition: A type of coffee made with espresso and milk.
sentence: While waiting for friends in the coffee shop, I drank a cappuccino.

definition: A lively piece of music.
sentence: He finished the song with a short capriccio.

definition: Fault-finding.
sentence: It’s impolite to utter captious statements about others.

definition: To attract and hold the interest of.
sentence: The beauty of the coastal scenery will captivate you on your trip.

definition: A travelling funfair or amusement show.
sentence: The children begged to go to the carnival when it was in town.

definition: The female reproductive part of a flower.
sentence: The carpels are typically found in the centre of the flower.

definition: A person who draws or produces maps.
sentence: David Thompson was a renowned explorer, surveyor and cartographer.

definition: A reddish variety of grape.
sentence: My grandmother likes to use Catawba grapes to make jelly.

definition: A prickly vine of eastern North America that grows in tangled masses.
sentence: A type of root beer, sarsaparilla, is made from the roots of catbrier.

definition: A class or group of things, people etc. who possess some quality in common.
sentence: The movie won an Oscar in the category of Best Picture.

definition: A personal possession other than land and buildings.
sentence: A car can be considered a chattel.

definition: The branch of science concerned with the composition, properties, and reactions of substances.
sentence: The medical team studied the patient’s blood chemistry to try to come up with a diagnosis.

definition: A marked area on a map, usually in colour, showing the distribution of a particular attribute or data.
sentence: The advantage to choropleth maps is that the coloured areas make them easy to understand.

definition: An impure variety of marble with alternate white and greenish zones.
sentence: Holding a cipolin stone in your hand is said to provide a sense of calm and ease, ideal tools for meditation.

definition: The transport of oxygenated blood through the arteries and its return to the heart.
sentence: In science class, the students learned about the circulation of the blood supply through the body.

definition: The use of many words where fewer words will do.
sentence: The speech had to be shortened because of its circumlocution.

definition: A brittle hard, silvery white element.
sentence: The most common source of cobalt is as a by-product from nickel and copper ore.

definition: Items of food.
sentence: The family donated comestibles to the food bank each week when they shopped.

definition: An article of trade or commerce, as opposed to a service.
sentence: Water is considered one of Canada’s most precious commodities.

definition: The interchange of thoughts or information by speech, writing or signs.
sentence: When working on a project as a team, communication is important.

definition: An instrument with a magnetic pointer showing the direction of the magnetic north pole.
sentence: They were advised to take a compass when walking in the wilderness.

definition: The state of being finished.
sentence: Work on the new golf course is nearing completion.

definition: The state of being intricate; complication or difficulty.
sentence: Poverty is an issue of great complexity.

definition: A piece of writing as an academic exercise in grammatically acceptable writing.
sentence: As the teacher graded each composition, she looked for errors in grammar and spelling.

definition: An irresistible urge to behave in a certain way.
sentence: The teens felt a compulsion to babble on about what had happened.

definition: To placate or win over.
sentence: The referee was able to conciliate an angry competitor.

definition: Small pieces of coloured paper traditionally thrown after a wedding ceremony.
sentence: Because of the environmental impact of throwing confetti, the bride and groom asked people to blow bubbles instead.

definition: To use authority to take away someone’s property.
sentence: The customs agents at the airport have to confiscate the food items that passengers may not bring into Canada.

definition: Compliance or obedience.
sentence: The school expected conformity with the dress code.

definition: To become semi-solid, especially on cooling.
sentence: The children were anxiously waiting for the Jell-O to congeal.

definition: A member of the U.S. Congress, which is part of the government.
sentence: The congressman was visiting Canada to compare environmental policies.

definition: Relating to trees that bear cones.
sentence: Softwood lumber comes from the evergreen coniferous trees.

definition: The preservation and protection of the natural environment.
sentence: The volunteers made a significant difference in the ecology and conservation of the wetland area.

definition: The state of being combined into a unified whole.
sentence: The company proposed the consolidation of several departments in an effort to save money.

definition: A discussion or chat.
sentence: The group was deep in conversation about the proposed changed to the school timetable.

definition: Sociable; companionable.
sentence: The leader at the children’s day camp was really convivial.

definition: Balanced and effective interaction of movement, actions, etc.
sentence: The gymnast’s natural coordination on the balance beam impressed her coaches.

definition: Affecting only the appearance of something, rather than the substance.
sentence: The painting of the house was purely cosmetic, and not a structural improvement.

definition: Brave.
sentence: Knowing how performing in public scared him, the teacher said the student was very courageous to act in the school play.

definition: Sad and disappointed.
sentence: The team was crestfallen when they didn’t advance to the championship game.

definition: To modify something to suit a particular individual or purpose.

definition: The study of development of communications and automated controls.
sentence: The science of cybernetics is discovering many similarities between computers and the human brain.

definition: The gelatinous liquid that fills the inside of a cell.
sentence: The cytoplasm is composed of water, salts and various organic molecules.

definition: Dishonest and misleading to others.
sentence: Telephone and internet scams are deceitful.

definition: Referring to a tree that sheds its leaves annually.
sentence: Each fall, I like to go for a hike in the woods to see the beautiful colours of the deciduous trees.

definition: Characterized by good manners and conduct.
sentence: The children were taught to act in a decorous way when at the upcoming wedding.

definition: The amount by which a sum of money falls short of the required amount.
sentence: Due to declining sales, the company found itself in a deficit.

definition: To describe something precisely.

definition: Conduct, behaviour or deportment.

definition: The act of tearing something down.

definition: Having no money and few possessions.

definition: Disintegrated or worn away.

definition: The quality of being resolute; firmness of purpose.
sentence: The student’s determination got her onto the honour roll.

definition: Waste or debris of any kind.

definition: Slanting or oblique.

definition: Types of algae.
sentence: Freshwater diatoms can grow in standing water and are seen as a brownish sludge on the bottom.

definition: An airship.

definition: Written or verbal communication or debate.

definition: A conflict or variation, such as between facts, figures or claims.
sentence: A large discrepancy in the company’s financial statements led to an investigation.

definition: The action or process of talking about something to exchange ideas.

definition: Untidy and disordered.

definition: A disagreement, especially when leading to a quarrel.

definition: The action of separating something into parts.

definition: A white mineral found in sedimentary rocks and veins.

definition: The monetary unit of Greece prior to the adoption of the euro.

definition: A literary advisor on the staff or a theatre, film corporation, etc.

definition: A single-humped camel.

definition: In music, based on two main beats to the bar.
sentence: The composer used both duple and triple time in his composition.

definition: Not performing properly.
sentence: The computer was old and becoming dysfunctional.

definition: A small plant, with white bracts around its small flowers.
sentence: While walking in the Alps, the hikers came across an abundance of edelweiss.

definition: To instruct, especially morally.
sentence: When Martin Luther King Jr. gave his “I Have a Dream” speech in 1963, he intended to edify people about human rights.

definition: A newspaper article expressing the editor’s opinion on an issue.

definition: Weird and frightening; ghostly.
sentence: There was eerie music playing in the Hallowe’en haunted house.

definition: Detailed and intricate.
sentence: The elaborate security details protected the bank from robbery.

definition: Dignified grace in appearance, movement or behaviour.

definition: Difficult to find.

definition: A young eel, especially one that is migrating up a stream from the ocean.

definition: To get on board a ship or aircraft.
sentence: The passengers lined up to embark on their cruise.

definition: To break out from an egg, cocoon or pupa.
sentence: The butterfly will emerge from its cocoon when it is fully formed.

definition: A Spanish or Latin American turnover.
sentence: She used savoury ingredients to fill her empanada.

definition: Referring to expressing something forcefully and clearly.
sentence: He was emphatic in his denial of the accusation.

definition: To make someone stronger and more confident.
sentence: The organization’s goal was to empower the newcomers through strengthening their English skills.

definition: A confused mass or something twisted together.
sentence: Many whales die from entanglement in a fishing net.

definition: To imagine.
sentence: When I read a good novel, I can envision how the characters and places look.

definition: A central nervous system disorder characterized by seizures.

definition: The repetition of a word or phrase at the end of two or more successive verses.

definition: Being typical or like the regions at the Earth’s equator.
sentence: During the long Canadian winter, the family dreamed of a warm equatorial vacation.

definition: Characterized by fairness.
sentence: Everyone was satisfied by the judge’s equitable decision.

definition: To destroy or eliminate completely.
sentence: The use of vaccines has helped to eradicate some diseases.

definition: A hermit or recluse, especially one under a religious vow.
sentence: The eremite preferred to live a life of seclusion.

definition: To abrade or wear down.

definition: To abstain from or avoid.

definition: The state of belonging to a group with a common national or cultural tradition.

definition: To form an idea of the amount, number, or value of something.

definition: The process of turning liquid into vapour.

definition: In the end.

definition: To urge strongly.

definition: Marriage outside a specific tribe or similar social unit.

definition: The act of forcing someone to leave.

definition: To remove matter seen as unsuitable from a text.
sentence: The editor advised the author to expurgate some of the passages from the novel before publication.

definition: Referring to something of special beauty or charm.

definition: An outgoing and socially confident person.
sentence: An extrovert always wants to socialize.

definition: Places, amenities or pieces of equipment provided for a particular purpose.

definition: Relating to or inclined to dissention.

definition: Liability to be deceived or mistaken.
sentence: Technology is not a cure for human fallibility.

definition: A blacksmith.

definition: Weariness from bodily or mental exertion.
sentence: The backpackers were overcome by fatigue by the time they made camp for the night.

definition: Allegiance.

definition: To enrich the land.

definition: Intensely passionate; ardent.

definition: A strong, foul smell.

definition: Fictitious or imaginary.

definition: Loyalty.

definition: A rapidly rotating column of flames above an intense fire.

definition: Easily set on fire.

sentence: Ostriches and penguins are flightless birds.

definition: Bearing many blossoms.

definition: Collectively, the leaves of a plant.

definition: The ordinal form of the number forty.

definition: The façade of a building.

definition: Agitated and annoyed.

definition: A type of olive-brown seaweed with branching fronds and air bladders.

definition: A cyst or enlarged tendon, usually at the wrist.

definition: A person who tends a garden.

definition: A baboon-like, cliff-dwelling monkey that is native to Ethiopia.

definition: A category of art, music, or literature.
sentence: The girl’s favourite reading genre was science-fiction.

definition: Convex at both edges, as the moon is when it is more than half full.

definition: A sticky, waterlogged soil which is often lacking oxygen.

definition: Hateful and wicked.

definition: An auditorium or stadium.

definition: The family of primates which includes humans and their human-like ancestors.

definition: Dreadful or horrible.

sentence: The doctor used a hypodermic needle to administer the vaccine.

definition: Any of several aromatic herbs belonging to the mint family.

definition: Not feeling or showing emotion.

definition: Incapable of being described in words.

definition: To enrage.

definition: An indirect or covert hint about someone, especially of a derogatory nature.

definition: Communication or direct involvement with someone or something.

definition: To alter or enlarge by the insertion of new material.

definition: To stop a person in the midst of doing or saying something.

definition: To list.

definition: A school year that precedes grade one.

definition: To grow weak.

definition: Relating to be drowsy or sluggish.

definition: Connected with the sea.

definition: The state of being married.

definition: The process of growing up and becoming responsible for one’s self.

definition: An ambulance or other vehicle, especially a helicopter, used for emergency transport of medical patients.

definition: Continued or extended thought; contemplation.
sentence: In this hustle and bustle world, some people like the calm of meditation.

definition: Confusion; turmoil; jumble.

definition: Primarily concerned with making money at the expense of ethics.

definition: A figure of speech that compares two unrelated things, typically by saying that one thing is another.

definition: A number from which another number is subtracted.

definition: The lowest point.

definition: Lazily careless; offhand.

definition: Relating to architecture, literature or music that draws influence from ancient Greek or Roman art and design.
sentence: In many old cities in Europe, you will find examples of neoclassical architecture.

definition: A chemical substance released at the end of a nerve fibre.
sentence: A neurotransmitter sends an impulse to the next cell.

definition: Petty, trivial or inconsequential.
sentence: The teacher said not to quibble about a niggling difference in terminology.

definition: A fine yet strong silky fabric.
sentence: The curtains in the stately home were made of ninon.

definition: Publicly known in an unfavourable way.
sentence: The rapper was notorious for his use of profanity.

definition: Easily seen, recognized or understood.
sentence: The very tall student was an obvious choice for the basketball team.

definition: To serve as a referee or umpire.
sentence: The gym teacher was a good choice to officiate at the track and field event.

definition: Not able to be seen through.
sentence: The bathroom window has opaque glass.

definition: A view or a judgement formed about something.
sentence: An opinion is not necessarily based on fact or knowledge.

definition: The state of being richly appointed or supplied; abundance.
sentence: The traveller was impressed by the opulence of the hotel.

definition: A doorkeeper in a church.
sentence: Originally, an ostiary was given the duty of opening and closing the church door, as well as guarding the church.

definition: An upholstered footstool.
sentence: While watching a movie, my father likes to sit with his feet up on the ottoman.

definition: A person or thing that is different from all the members of a particular group.
sentence: The group came to see a different perspective after the outlier spoke.

definition: Showing too much confidence or pride.
sentence: The student’s overweening ambition made him strive for top marks.

definition: Referring to a person being pale or lacking in colour.
sentence: My mother wondered if something was upsetting me because my face was so pallid.

definition: Readily or plainly seen, heard or perceived.
sentence: The parents could tell his excuse was a palpable lie.

definition: A large gland behind the stomach.
sentence: The pancreas secretes digestive enzymes.

definition: A person trained to give emergency medical care.
sentence: The paramedic was able to take care of the patient until they could reach the hospital.

definition: The state of being equal.
sentence: The workers went on strike to try to get wage parity between men and women.

definition: Associated with country life.
sentence: Urban sprawl threatens pastoral scenery.

definition: The science of origin, nature and course of a disease.
sentence: By studying the pathology of a virus, scientists can hope to find a cure or vaccine for it.

definition: Excessive concern with minor details and rules.
sentence: The man’s pedantry tested the patience of everybody on the board.

definition: A plane figure with five straight sides and five angles.
sentence: For homework, they had to measure the inside angles of each pentagon on the paper.

definition: A framework in a garden or park.
sentence: The gardener built a pergola in his yard to support his climbing plants.

definition: Persistent harassment.
sentence: The principal explained that cyberbullying is a form of persecution.

definition: An edible fruit.
sentence: She bought a persimmon from the fruit market for a snack.

definition: To bicker or quibble over unimportant matters.
sentence: The mother told the boys not to pettifog over who got the front seat, or they would have to take the bus to school.

definition: A chemical salt.
sentence: The phosphate in the detergent is a pollutant.

definition: A form of journalism in which photos dominate the written copy.
sentence: The popular magazine won many photojournalism awards.

definition: The external part of the ear in humans and other mammals.
sentence: The aardvark can fold the pinna to protect its internal ear.

definition: An expression of praise or approval.
sentence: The student received many plaudits for her science fair project.

definition: A secluded enclosure in a garden.
sentence: The manor house had a pleasance at the back of the garden.

definition: The abdomen of a crustacean.
sentence: Among other things, the pleon is used for swimming.

definition: Referring to Polynesia, its inhabitants, or their language.
sentence: The Polynesian islands are in the South Pacific.

definition: All the inhabitants of a place.
sentence: It seemed the entire populace of the small town came out to welcome the Olympic medalist back home.

definition: The language of Portugal and Brazil.
sentence: The family was learning to speak Portuguese in anticipation of their trip to Lisbon.

definition: A person who practices a profession or activity, especially medicine.
sentence: The patient was treated by a nurse practitioner.

definition: Rain, snow, sleet or hail.
sentence: In a Canadian winter, precipitation is often in the form of snow.

definition: An unpleasantly difficult, confusing or dangerous situation.
sentence: Losing my wallet while on vacation put me in an awkward predicament.

definition: Dislike or hostility coming from preconceived and unfounded opinions.
sentence: The war against prejudice seems to be never-ending.

definition: The first performance.
sentence: The audience was excited to see the premiere of the new movie.

definition: An assumption made beforehand as the basis of an argument or theory.
sentence: To say that a UFO came again is based on a presupposition that one had come before.

definition: To determine the order according to relative importance.
sentence: My father likes to prioritize his to-do list each day.

definition: A special advantage granted to a particular person or group.
sentence: Education is a right and no longer a privilege of the rich.

definition: Likelihood.
sentence: The meteorologist said there was a probability of rain today.

definition: A micro-organism with beneficial properties to the intestinal tract.
sentence: Some doctors recommend taking a probiotic following treatment with antibiotics.

definition: An established or official course of action.
sentence: The school had a procedure in place for fire drills.

definition: Lasting for a very long time.
sentence: Astronauts who spend a protracted amount of time in space suffer muscular problems when they return to Earth.

definition: A supply or stock of something, such as food.
sentence: The family made sure to have provisions on hand in case of a power failure during the upcoming storm.

definition: Nearness in space, time or relationship.
sentence: When looking for a new home, close proximity to schools and stores was important.

definition: Public attention.
sentence: The celebrity was angry about the publicity surrounding her divorce.

definition: Marks, such as periods and commas, used in writing to separate clauses or sentences.
sentence: Proper punctuation makes text easier to understand.

definition: Range of experience or understanding.
sentence: She felt she could not answer the question immediately, because it was not in the purview of her knowledge.

definition: A range of mountains between France and Spain.
sentence: The highest peak of the Pyrenees is in Northern Spain.

definition: In North America, a one followed by 15 zeroes.
sentence: After a million, billion and trillion comes a number known as a quadrillion.

definition: Done or produced four times a year.
sentence: The magazine is issued quarterly.

definition: Five times as much.
sentence: The small company hoped to quintuple the number of employees the following year.

definition: Not of special quality or interest; ordinary.
sentence: The judge said the paintings are pleasant to look at, but show nothing more than quotidian talent.

definition: Aggressive greed.
sentence: The history book told of the rapacity of Vikings.

definition: The violent seizure and carrying off of another’s property.
sentence: I really enjoyed reading the story of pirates and their rapine of ships crossing the ocean.

definition: The practice of exchanging things with others for mutual benefit.
sentence: After a dinner party, the neighbours invited us to their house next time as an act of reciprocity.

definition: To remember something.
sentence: The witness was asked to recollect what happened.

definition: To build or form again.
sentence: Council had a plan to reconstruct the bridge over the river as the structure was getting old.

definition: The action of making something smaller in amount, degree, or size.
sentence: Because of on-line shopping, there is a reduction in the number of people going into stores.

definition: The act of redirecting someone or something for consultation or further action.
sentence: After she broke her leg, she was given a referral to the fracture clinic.

definition: A place where records of births, deaths, and marriages are kept.
sentence: I had to contact the government registry when I needed a replacement birth certificate.

definition: To restore something or someone to a former condition.
sentence: The environmental campaign aimed to rehabilitate the river’s flood plain.

definition: To return to a less active or worse state.
sentence: The doctor advised him that he could relapse if he didn’t rest.

definition: To take away from its original position.
sentence: The recipe said to sauté gently and then remove the pan from the heat.

definition: A person who deserts his cause or beliefs; a traitor.
sentence: The sports fan was considered a renegade by his friends when he switched his allegiance to a different hockey team.

definition: The action of remodeling a building.
sentence: The home-owners did an extensive renovation to their house before moving in.

definition: Characterized by reiterating or redoing.
sentence: Because it is repetitive work, the worker said her job requires little concentration.

definition: A person who is chosen to act or speak on behalf of others.
sentence: The union elected a representative to meet with the company.

definition: To gently criticize or correct.
sentence: The teacher had to reprove the student for often being late for class.

definition: Noisy and disorderly conduct.
sentence: The teenagers were asked to leave the community centre because of their rowdiness.

definition: A North American plant in the heather family.
sentence: The salal has edible black berries.

definition: A shaker or small dish for salt.
sentence: My mother asked me to pass her the saltcellar.

definition: A hydroponic method of growing plants using a sand bed rather than soil.
sentence: The gardener tried the sandculture method to grow herbs.

definition: A sandstone boulder.
sentence: Ancient people used sarsen stone in the construction of Stonehenge.

definition: A timetable or a plan.
sentence: Before the group bought their tickets, they checked the train schedule.

definition: A view of an expanse of sea.
sentence: The artist was known for painting beautiful seascapes.

definition: The state of being private and away from other people.
sentence: The family enjoyed a week of seclusion at their cottage.

definition: The state of being hidden or concealed.
sentence: The jury members held their discussion in total secrecy.

definition: In zoology, conspicuous colours and markings serving as a signal, usually of warning.
sentence: The bright colours of the poison dart frog are sematic to predators.

definition: Relating to an animal that lives partly on land and partly in water.
sentence: They were watchful for the semiaquatic crocodiles.

definition: A soldier or guard whose job is to keep watch.
sentence: At the fort, the sentinel patrolled the ramparts.

definition: The subdivision of an Irish or Scottish clan.
sentence: In times of crisis the sept rallied under one leader.

definition: Referring to a notched or saw-like blade on a knife.
sentence: My mother cut the raisin bread with a serrated knife.

definition: The last six lines of a sonnet in the Italian form, considered as a separate unit.
sentence: There are two sections to the Petrarchan, or Italian sonnet: the first eight lines, called an octave, and the sestet.

definition: Intensive or sharpness, as in cold or pain.
sentence: Due to the severity of her broken leg, the doctor said he would have to operate.

definition: A light woolen fabric once used for lining garments, especially military uniforms.
sentence: With the advent of the industrial revolution making machine-spun and woven cotton fabrics cheaper to produce, fabrics like shalloon disappeared.

definition: The basic monetary unit of Israel.
sentence: A shekel is equal to 100 agorot.

definition: Smooth or wet, making it difficult to hold on or to stand.
sentence: The floor is slippery when it is wet.

definition: A glass enclosed room.
sentence: My parents added a solarium to the back of the house.

definition: To ask for, or try to obtain, something.
sentence: The magazine rejected the writer’s piece saying it only publishes solicited articles.

definition: Unity among like-minded people.
sentence: The solidarity of unions helped to create better working conditions for everyone.

definition: The state of being alone.
sentence: I need solitude to meditate.

definition: Able to be dissolved, especially in water.
sentence: Sugar is a soluble substance.

definition: A poem consisting of fourteen lines.
sentence: The song writer wrote a love lyric in the form of a sonnet.

definition: Clusters of spore-producing receptacles on the underside of ferns.
sentence: The biologist studied the sori with a microscope.

definition: An instrument in a vehicle that indicates how fast it is travelling.
sentence: He kept an eye on the speedometer to avoid going over the speed limit.

definition: A noose or snare for catching small game.
sentence: The survivalist used a springe to catch animals for his food.

definition: A widely held image or idea of a particular type of person or thing.
sentence: The active senior citizen of today does not fit the old stereotype.

definition: Seriously affected by an undesirable condition.
sentence: Before vaccines, too many children were stricken with polio.

definition: Small seedless raisins.
sentence: My mother asked me to buy some sultanas to add to the fruit cake.

definition: Being in charge.
sentence: The supervisory staff at the summer camp were responsible for the children’s safety.

definition: A gregarious, burrowing meerkat.
sentence: When they went to the zoo, the children exclaimed about the dark bands on the back and the black tipped tail of the suricate.

definition: Temporarily withholding of a privilege.
sentence: The hockey player got a one game suspension for unsportsmanlike conduct.

definition: A mountainous land-locked country in Europe.
sentence: The alpine areas of Switzerland are renowned for skiing.

definition: That which is arranged in a system of columns and rows.
sentence: A tabular format is often the most efficient method to display numeric information.

definition: Anything thought to have magical or protective powers.
sentence: The girl believed that the ring she wore was a talisman against bad luck.

definition: A person skilled in operating or repairing some type of machinery or equipment.
sentence: The technician set up our new computer.

definition: A small top that is spun with the fingers.
sentence: The child spent hours spinning his teetotum on every available surface.

definition: The desire to do something, especially something that is unwise.
sentence: She could not resist the temptation to buy a Hallowe’en costume for her dog.

definition: The monetary unit of Kazakhstan.
sentence: I was given a tenge for my coin collection.

definition: A slender, flexible limb on some creatures that is used for movement and for grasping objects.
sentence: The squid’s tentacles are armed with suckers, each ringed with tiny teeth to help snare prey.

definition: A male hawk, especially a peregrine.
sentence: The peregrine hen can be up to thirty percent bigger than the tercel.

definition: Irritable or bad tempered.
sentence: The heat wave was making everyone just a little bit tetchy.

definition: The vegetative body of algae, fungi and lichens.
sentence: A thallus does not have distinct parts, such as leaves, roots and stems.

definition: Three times.
sentence: As told by the spectre of Marley, Scrooge would be thrice visited by ghosts.

definition: Pertaining to the gland in the neck responsible for regulating metabolism and growth.
sentence: An underactive thyroid gland can make it difficult to maintain a healthy weight.

definition: An Italian dessert consisting of layers of sponge cake soaked in coffee and brandy, with powdered chocolate and mascarpone cheese.
sentence: The restaurant was well-known for its tiramisu.

definition: The trunk of the human body.
sentence: In biology, the teacher used 3D imaging of a torso to help teach anatomy.

definition: A condition in which the head becomes persistently inclined to one side.
sentence: The medical term for a wry neck is torticollis.

definition: Crossing a continent.
sentence: When the last spike was driven in 1885, the transcontinental railway connected both sides of Canada.

definition: The process of moving something from one place to another.
sentence: The transference of liquid chemicals, such as crude oil, from one ship to another can enable carriers to optimize their routes and reduce costs.

definition: To travel across or through.
sentence: The hiker planned to traverse the Bruce Trail.

definition: The violent and noisy commotion of a crowd or mob.
sentence: There were fears that the peaceful protest could turn into a tumult.

definition: An opaque mineral that is bluish-green in colour.
sentence: Over time, turquoise has become synonymous with New Mexico.

definition: Next after nineteenth in numerical order.
sentence: The girl was no longer a teenager after her twentieth birthday.

definition: Beyond what is evident or admitted.
sentence: There was an ulterior motive behind his request for a break in the meeting.

definition: Sounds or other vibrations having ultrasonic frequency, used in medical imaging.
sentence: Because it uses sound waves instead of radiation, an ultrasound is safer than an x-ray.

definition: Uncontrolled or unrestrained.
sentence: His unbridled ambition turned him into a workaholic.

definition: Not confined.
sentence: When school finished for the summer, the children ran out with unfettered excitement.

definition: So bad as to be unable to be excused or pardoned.
sentence: The judge said the crimes of the guilty man were unforgivable.

definition: Not spoiled.
sentence: The new tablecloth was unsullied by stains.

definition: Superior to any other in achievement or excellence.
sentence: The athlete’s medal count was unsurpassed by any other athlete.

definition: A person who is employed to park cars.
sentence: The hotel patron handed his car keys to the valet.

definition: An open porch, usually roofed, and partly enclosed by a railing.
sentence: We enjoyed sitting on the veranda in the evening chatting to people walking past.

definition: Gilded silver or bronze.
sentence: He couldn’t tell if the piece of jewelry was made with precious metal, or simply vermeil.

definition: A quiver or tremor.
sentence: Even though he was deaf, the boy could feel the vibration of music by holding his hand to the speaker.

definition: Experienced in the imagination through the feelings or actions of another person.
sentence: Looking at the magazine of luxury lifestyles, brought him vicarious pleasure.

definition: Real, but existing or happening on line, rather than in person.
sentence: The students were able to do a virtual tour of the museum before they went on their field trip.

definition: Glutinous or sticky.
sentence: The spider spun a viscid web that clung to the tree.

definition: One of the countries that makes up the United Kingdom.
sentence: After visiting England, they continued west into Wales.

definition: A water-soluble compound with anticoagulant properties.
sentence: After his heart attack, the patient was given warfarin as a blood thinner.

definition: Aquatic birds.
sentence: Ducks and geese are waterfowl.

definition: A small African bird.
sentence: The male whydah has a long black tail.

definition: An uncultivated and uninhabited area.
sentence: The group liked to walk into the wilderness on their hikes.

definition: A tough willow twig suitable for binding things together.
sentence: We tied a splint on my injured ankle using a withe from a nearby tree.

definition: A person who is present at the signing of a document, and then signs it himself to indicate this.
sentence: He was pleased to be asked to be a witness to their wedding.

definition: To shape metal by hammering.
sentence: The new railing at the hotel was wrought by a blacksmith.

definition: A child or young person.
sentence: He felt like a youngster compared to the other people in his book group.
